LanguageData.SurgeryPolicy_TipKey: Create and manage policy templates to control the surgical procedures for prisoners.
LanguageData.SurgeryPolicy_Info:
Assign a surgery policy to the prisoner: Create a new policy or select an existing one. 
 Surgery policies are one-time procedures. Once assigned, the prisoner will undergo the surgeries in the policy. 
 After completion, the policy remains marked but will not be repeated, unless the policy itself is modified. 

 Special Policies: 
 None Policy: Schedule no surgeries. 
 Clear All Surgeries: Removes all pending surgeries from this prisoner's surgery list. Does not affect surgeries currently in progress.
LanguageData.SurgeryPolicy_NonePolicy_Info: This policy is a system preset policy. No surgeries will be scheduled for this prisoner.
LanguageData.SurgeryPolicy_ClearPolicy_Info: This policy is a system preset policy. Removes all pending surgeries from this prisoner's surgery list. Does not affect surgeries currently in progress.
LanguageData.SurgeryPolicy_Delete_Report: Cannot delete system default surgery policy
LanguageData.SurgeryPolicy_WhenUseDelete_Report: This surgery policy is in use. Please remove it from all assigned characters first: {0}
LanguageData.SurgeryApplyMode_ReplaceAll_Tip: Clear all current surgeries and completely replace with policy surgeries.
LanguageData.SurgeryApplyMode_Append_Tip: Keep current surgeries and add policy surgeries.
LanguageData.ColumnStripShiftClickTip: Shift + click: Strip all\nShift + right click: Cancel all
LanguageData.GeneExtraction_Info:
In this setting, select the genes you want to extract from prisoners. After saving and clicking execute, prisoners with matching genes will be automatically added to the gene extractor's task list.

Operation Instructions:
1. Click on genes in the left "Optional Genes" list to add them to the extraction list
2. Click on genes in the right "Selected Genes" list to remove them
3. Use the top search box to quickly find specific genes
4. After selecting genes, click the "Save" button to save the current settings
5. Click the "Execute" button to start the gene extraction process
6. Click "Cancel Execution" to pause gene extraction, but this will not cancel tasks already in progress

Note:
Only genes that can be extracted by gene extractors will be displayed in this list.
The execution process is a periodic task. After clicking execute, it will continue running until there are no qualifying prisoners or no available gene extractors.
